page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT,TECHNOLOGY,S.T.C.
page.content: Yesterday we visited a factory called{S.T.C.}(Standard Telephones and Cables). When we arrived we had to wear I.D. cards and a man showed us round the part where they make the push button telephones. It was great. We saw all the machines putting in microchips and things and people checking that the phones worked okay. When we got back to school we had to find out more about S.T.C. We discovered that the factory was opened in 1962 and was the second biggest of 14 such factories in the U.K. The site covers 42 acres now. We found it also made telephone exchanges and used to employ 2,000 people though the man told us that many people have lost their jobs recently and some more might be made redundant soon.
